Whatever you need to do to distract yourself from the negative thoughts. Distraction is the key but it does take practice. As someone who has suffered with depression most of my adult life, I #8217;ve learnt to focus completely on a tv show or film or some other task so that my mind doesn #8217;t wonder. Or I sleep if I really need to get away from thoughts. Being with friends is the best answer or having a good in-depth chat with someone you have a connection with. I also try to help others, a) because I feel the need to and b) it helps to distract myself from my issues. Try to keep smiling as you #8217;re stunning and I hope you don #8217;t have many days where you doubt your worth. The world is better for you being in it x

I totally get what you mean. I don't have a huge amount of relationship experience or have women regularly wanting to date me lol But I have seen a lot from other people and been on a lot of first dates. I think everything in life is a compromise but it's about prioritising the things that you won't compromise on. And for me, attraction is one of the things that you can't force. Personally I want what my grandparents had. As much in love at the end as when they met. So I would identify the things that are deal breakers for you. The other stuff, give them a chance to see if they either meet your expectations or whether you can live with it. That's my thought for what it's worth. Hope you're staying safe over there in the Emerald Isle x

WRITING.TITLE: 41 [M4F] UK Be careful. People are going strange....

Actually I've just been talking about this with the microwave and toaster while drinking coffee and we all agreed that things are getting bad. I didn't mention anything to the washing machine as she puts a different spin on everything. Certainly not to the fridge as he is acting cold and distant. In the end the iron straightened me out as she said everything will be fine, no situation is too pressing. The vacuum was very unsympathetic... told me to just suck it up, but the fan was more optimistic and hoped it would all soon blow over! I think 95% of reddit is in the US lol. Must be a thing over there ;) Well for me it's silly jokes I love, not necessarily those about shit, but should your focusing on the shit tell me anything about you? ;)
Love isn #8217;t about finding the prefect person but learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.
Just wow. Fantastic.
Stunning #128525;
I can remember the things that happened, I sometimes get a flash of what it was like or what it felt like, but generally it seems like it was someone else.

A powerful and perfect explanation. Thank you for sharing. I often say that beating depression is like having a broken leg and trying to run it off. Your delivery and voice is very soothing, empathetic and I #8217;m sure brings validation and comfort to all who hear your x
Is it something like #8220;Kee Ver #8221; or #8220;Kwee Ver #8221;?

WRITING.TITLE: 41 [M4F] I'd just like to say to the man wearing camouflage and using crutches who stole my wallet...
WRITING.TEXT: ...you can hide but you can't run! Boom boom Bored silly joke lover, out of a LTR a few months back, isolating on his own. Starting to get busier as I get back into the single, living alone frame of mind and getting used to finding things to occupy myself again but always happy to make new friends and talk to ladies about literally anything. Maybe if things go well, meet up when we're allowed but if not online chatting, either long term or short term, is good. So hit me with your best silly joke. :)

Unfortunately you can #8217;t but then any time people look for love they run the risk of being hurt, not just with OLD but in general. It #8217;s lovely that you don #8217;t want to hurt anyone and are trying to answer all the messages but most of it is not in your control and that will be an impossible task so best to filter out the ones that interest you.

I can empathise with your position entirely. I think a Robbie Williams lyric sums up my and probably your situation. "I don't want to die, but I ain't keen on living either." One of the worst things I've had to do is admit this in front of my parents at interviews with professionals and Government representatives. But I think most people want to be alive but aren't necessarily aware that every day they make the choice to be alive. Whereas some people consciously make that choice rather than the alternative.

Again I can empathise with that. The trick is to try to control those thoughts as much as possible, take each day one at a time, try to get some pleasure out of even the smallest things, and leave the rest to fate. If we choose not to do the unthinkable then we really have no other choice.....other than to just survive as comfortably as possible. But you have exactly the right idea of how many people would be hurt or affected if you did. Not just those that know and love you, but the Paramedics who tend to you, the Police Officer who has to inform your family...they tell me that never gets easier. But I'm sure the world is a better place for you being in it and we are noble in enduring our suffering so that we don't pass it onto others. You should be proud of that.

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone else got the tune from "Eat Shit Bob" permanently stuck in their heads?
WRITING.TEXT: The greatest song and dance routine of all time and the funniest way to tell someone to "Eat Shit". Makes me proud to be a fellow Brit lol. But damnit, I've got that tune pretty much permanently stuck in my head.

Don't fret. You've got plenty of time to find "the one". I've seen some comments that the pandemic has actually made dating easier. People talk a lot online and find out quite quickly if they are not suited, and then have online dates. Not only does that mean you're more comfortable if and when you do meet, it saves time and expense going on lots of dates that don't work out. Got to admit they have a point lol. Try to chill at the moment, let's get through this and then worry about the future. One day at a time at the moment :)
Apologies. Didn't mean offence. Removed.
Very useful though. When I used to fly light aircraft, one lady I flew with was similarly endowed. No need for life jackets if we went down in the sea. Just hang onto her until help arrived ;)

Similar story to me except I was single pretty much all of my twenties apart from "involvments", in a relationship for my thirties now single again and even though I was single in my twenties I didn't make the most of them for various reasons. Back at square one now. But my thirties were better than my twenties so I'm sure you'll enjoy yours. :)

Can't speak for other men but I definitely prefer the natural look. For me too much make up can make a beautiful girl unattractive. Unfortunately with online dating people are generally going on looks alone but I would much rather see what girls look like every day because that's the person I'm interested in getting to know.
I've taken part in a very similar study for depression. Saliva sample and then completing several surveys which is an ongoing thing I do. I'll check this one out too.
About 15 years ago I actually did the whole saliva thing as a result of meeting a registrar who was involved in research of this kind. Then repeated the test a year later but nothing ever came of it.

WRITING.TITLE: You're tired? You should get out and exercise more! Oh REALLY? I should, should I?
WRITING.TEXT: Anybody else get tired of that advice whether it's for CFS or Depression? All the "solutions" to these two conditions (get out more, exercise, improve your diet, sleep well and have a routine, think positive etc etc) come under the heading of "if I could do that I wouldn't have a feckin problem would I?" With depression especially, they're basically saying I should use my broken brain to fix my brain. Ever get the urge to break the legs of people who say this sort of thing and tell them to run it off or is it just me? lol And of course the old "you're tired because you're depressed". Yeah there is a link but who's to say I'm not depressed because I'm tired? It takes energy to be happy. It takes energy to do all the things being suggested in order to cure my depression and tiredness. Sorry just had to vent. I know the people who say these things are well meaning but jeez...
I'm sure their intentions are good and they think they're helping, but they just don't realise that it's mental torture.
No #128563; is it as good as they say? lol
Good point. I like that. :)
That's a fabulous description. I love that. Probably the best explanation I've heard and worded so well.
Even though I'm incredibly lucky to only have the fatigue, no pain....so much this #9757; #65039;

Thankfully my symptoms are mild compared to a lot of people and it's not that common for me to get unsolicited advice these days as most people who know me now know not to. In a lot of ways I'm very lucky compare to most people, especially people on this sub, most of whom seem to suffer more than me. So I empathise and sympathise with you all too.

"You're not similar enough to my ex husband." #129300; "You're moving too fast" after sending flowers to welcome her back from a holiday that she invited me to join her on after one date and one brief meet up. #129300;
Oh no, not at all. It wasn't a criticism. I'm just very aware that lots of people suffer more than me and I feel for them.

Yeah I still don't understand that one although the second one really mucked me up. We did hit it off really well on the date, I liked her a lot and was hoping things would progress. Did find it a bit odd that she said she almost didn't want to go on holiday now as she didn't expect to like me so much so quick. Not sure how serious she was about me joining her on the second week but hey ho.

No worries. I'm a very self aware person, probably too self critical, but reading about other people's experiences (here and elsewhere) makes me aware of just how lucky I am that mine is not so severe. It still sucks but mine could be a hell of a lot worse and I feel for those who suffer more than me.
Don't think so. A year later she was wth someone, I know because she told me when she texted asking if I wanted to be friends. #129300;
That's kinda what I thought lol
Not seen it. I'll have to check it out lol
And other things....although she can't have assessed me on that. We were fully clothed the whole time #128563;

WRITING.TITLE: Hello. My name's Mike and I'm an "Eat Shit Bob!" aholic.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm 41, in the UK and immensely proud of our best export - John Oliver. But I have a problem. "Eat Shit Bob!" is taking over my life. I can't stop watching it, humming it, whistling it. I think I'm going to form a support group for other sufferers. Anybody interested? #128513;
Allegedly......(see what I did there)....that's the least of what he's done #128563;
I'd better hire a bigger hall for the meetings then ;)
Well some of us are definitely riveted by your "Goings on" but we've got our fair share of drama and morons over here too unfortunately.
I feel for yer. We've got a similar situation here. I think your guy is significantly worse than ours but there's a lot of similarities :(
It does but at least we finally found out who the Zodiac killer was #128563;
That #8217;s exactly who I #8217;m talking about #129322;
And squirrels #128063;
Seems like me might have to arrange national meetings in each country. There seems to be a big need for this service.

I was a late starter and I'm certainly no expert but I think the only time I regretted having sex was the first time. It was a woman I was infatuated with, thought she liked me, she was a lot more experienced but when it came to the "event" she was not supportive, didn't put me at ease and consequently it didn't go well. Over the next few months it transpired that I was just "useful" to have around for her and she was only "fond" of me. So my regret was that my first time was with the wrong person. So my only advice would be that if you feel comfortable with this guy, and he sounds very supportive and respectful, you want him to be your first and your head is mostly in control, then the chances of you regretting it are slim, or at least reduced. Best of luck.
What they said #9757; #65039;
Exactly.

WRITING.TITLE: Ghosters please don't bother.
WRITING.TEXT: I know that women have to be careful, I know they encounter a lot of creeps and nasty bits of work and I get that misunderstandings can easily happen online, but if you don't want to talk to a guy anymore at least tell him or if he says something you don't like, at least give him the chance to explain or apologise etc. If he then turns angry or nasty you can block him. Job done. I'm sure I'll get ripped to shreds for this but it really is soul destroying to spend a lot of time and effort building a connection, being respectful etc only to get ghosted with no explanation. #128542;
Tried CBD for fatigue (not pain) and all it did was upset my stomach. Think it's more for pain than fatigue but I've heard that some people get good results with the pain.
I had the capsules so maybe I should try the drinks. Didn't know they did drinks but I'm needing energy rather than pain relief and I don't think that's really what CBD is for :(
Oh I don't need anything for sedation lol It's the opposite I need ;)

I mean I've ended up talking to some strange women and at the point I decided it was not a person I wanted to keep talking to, or THEY said something very off-putting, I told them that and wished them well.

A nice easy EDF to fly is the HK Vampire. I had the first version and because of it's semi straight wing (rather than swept) it flies beautifully, glides in for landing. I loved it. Nice relaxed flying.

That would depend on how competent you are at flying the Apprentice but I would say you should be fine. If not a Wot 4 or Acrowot (nitro or electric) are always a good second. Seagull Low Wing Trainer is a wonderful first low wing aerobatic aircraft. Lovely to fly and does every manoeuvre in the book.
The Vampire would probably be fine for you then.
Glad to be of service #128513;

Definitely the woman before sex even begins. It's not certain that the woman will cum from penetration alone so making her cum first during foreplay ensures that not only do both people get to orgasm, but it makes her sensitive to increase her pleasure for what comes next.

WRITING.TITLE: 41 [M4F] May the odds be ever in your favour.
WRITING.TEXT: Well I'm hoping they will be in mine. I've been single since the start of the year, just in time for that which shall not be named, and at about the same time as the neighbours, whose dog I played with and whose cat used to come and keep me company, moved away. So very much missing affection and intimacy right now. Cosy nights on the sofa with a good film etc etc I've made some really wonderful connections with ladies all over the world (who have become valued friends) but sadly none that have lasted in the UK and it's a bit hard to hug over the internet. So I'd love to chat to any UK ladies and see where things go. I'm open to online chats, possible meet ups, friends online or in real life. If hugs are involved that's a bonus. I won't go into detail about myself as that would not leave us much to talk about initially as we get to know each other. But I'm in the South East and for what it's worth this is me (appearance seems to be important online). [https://imgur.com/sHtsxdO](https://imgur.com/sHtsxdO) I love silly jokes so feel free to hit me with your best rib tickler if you're stuck for an opening line. #128513;

If your boyfriend really thinks that and doesn't realise he's the luckiest guy in the world to have a girlfriend with an amazing body like yours, then I think he needs an eye test at the very least. You have a fabulous body, amazing breasts, wonderful tummy, perfect ass, voluptuous and so sexy. Your body is a lovely shape. I know it's hard when people we care about tell us negative things, but I think he's so wrong.

I disagree. I don't think anyone should have to hear things like that from someone they love and in a relationship you should build each other up not the other way round. When I love I love everything about the person and I want to make them feel great. I would not want to be with someone who affects my self esteem no matter how much I might love them.

Oh totally. I agree with that. It is a choice to be made if the OP really wants to stay with him and it's the age old thing of treading the fine line between love and it being harmful to yourself. Very difficult to do. Love is about loving the good and living with the bad but there are obviously limits and that is for the individual to try to decide. It's not easy but I wish her luck.

Not wrong at all and no you shouldn #8217;t do it if you #8217;re not comfortable. We all like receiving nudes and if that #8217;s all both parties want then great. But if you #8217;re hoping for more, the right guy will not make you feel bad for not doing it. Don #8217;t do it just to make other people happy. If you do do it though, make sure you don #8217;t include your face and nothing in the background that could identify you.

In which case he #8217;s not the guy for you. It #8217;s not up to you to make him happy. You don #8217;t owe him anything. If he #8217;s making you feel bad already that #8217;s not a good recipe for success. And if he says he will look elsewhere then he is clearly only after one thing. Sharing your body with someone is s very personal and trusting act. He doesn #8217;t sound very trustworthy or respectful.
What Dan said #9757; #65039;
All red flags and it seems that you will be the one that ends up getting hurt. I certainly wouldn #8217;t trust either of them.
So many but top would probably be Jack The Ripper.
Just WOW! That's amazing.

Not sure if this counts but in the case of The Yorkshire Ripper the police ignored or did not connect some victims because they believed the killer was only targeting prostitutes. The chief investigating officer, George Oldfield, also became convinced that a tape recording sent to them (and also some letters) was from the killer despite many people pointing out that it couldn't have been. Because of this the Police only focused on men with the accent on the tape and discounted the actual killer, even though many officers had suspicions about him, because he didn't have the same accent as the man on the tape. One victim who survived even gave them a photofit of her attacker that was spot on and told them that the voice on the tape was not the man who attacked her but Oldfield was convinced that she was not a victim of the ripper because she wasn't a prostitute so her evidence wasn't taken seriously. Several women's lives could have been saved if Oldfield had not been so fixated on that tape which, of course, was a hoax.

Easy to be critical in hindsight and there were several factors working against the Police, not least being the sheer amount of information before the time of computers...so all on index cards. But the belief in the tape and letters certainly took the investigation away from the real killer.

I believe that several lines of enquiry were actually leading in his direction. My knowledge is gained from documentaries so not comprehensive and I may be wrong on some of this, but I believe that a #163;5 note the killer had given to one victim had been tracked down to having been issued in a pay packet by two companies, one of which Sutcliffe worked for. Also they had manually tracked down and eliminated thousands of cars that could have left a tyre track at one of the crime scenes and that was leading towards Sutcliffe but I believe that inquiry was stopped after the tape was received as that was considered a better lead. He was definitely interviewed multiple times and I think his car had been logged in the vicinity of red light areas several times. Would it have enabled them to catch him sooner and save the lives of several women? Well I guess people have been arguing over that ever since. Like with a lot of crimes, catching him eventually came down to luck and the suspicions of the Police Sergeant who went back to the arrest site and found the weapons.
Jack The Ripper is my ultimate favourite. unimaginative but fascinating.

Yes he didn't just kill them. He butchered them. In fact the killing was strangulation and throat cutting. Then he ripped them, disembowelled and in at least one case took an organ away with him. Mary Kelly was unrecognisable. He destroyed her. So many suspects ranging from the likely to the weird. Most people's favourite is Kosminski. However I saw a programme where someone said that they may have got him mixed up with another Polish "lunatic" who died in an asylum not long after the murders apparently stopped. I can't remember the details but in somebody's memoirs they had said the murderer was most likely a homicidal polish man who died in an asylum shortly after the murders but he never named the man. Now Kosminksi did die in an asylum but many many years after the murders. However there was a very violent and disturbed man who died in an asylum just after the murders so maybe it was him.
